EDIT2: this is the way I did, like you said to do:

[code]package server.model.players;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.Collection;
import java.util.Collections;
import java.util.LinkedList;
import java.util.List;
import server.Config;
import server.Server;
import server.model.items.Item;
import server.model.npcs.NPC;
import server.model.npcs.NPCHandler;
import server.util.ISAACRandomGen;
import server.util.Misc;
import server.util.Stream;
import server.world.map.*;

public abstract class Player {
public ArrayList lastKilledPlayers = new ArrayList();

//public long ignores[] = new long[200];
public long lastEmote;
public boolean DCDamg = false;
public int DCdown = 0, 	trade11;
public int staffReq;[/code]

public void getRequirements(String itemName, int itemId) { c.attackLevelReq = c.defenceLevelReq = c.strengthLevelReq = c.rangeLevelReq = c.magicLevelReq = c.Donatorreq = 0; c.staffReq = 0;

switch(itemId) { case 1: c.staffReq = 1; // mods case 2: c.staffReq = 2; // admins case 1635: c.staffReq = 3; // owner

if(Config.itemRequirements) { if(targetSlot == 10 || targetSlot == 7 || targetSlot == 5 || targetSlot == 4 || targetSlot == 0 || targetSlot == 9 || targetSlot == 10) { if(c.staffReq > 0) { if(c.playerRights < c.staffReq) { c.sendMessage("You don't have the authority to wear this item."); canWearItem = false; } }

if(targetSlot == 3) { if(c.staffReq > 0) { if(c.playerRights < c.staffReq) { c.sendMessage("You don't have the authority to wear this item."); canWearItem = false; } }

item.title: Owner items...[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Then here’'s an idea. Just like the untradeable array, create an ownersItem array.

So…

public int ownerItem[] = {1635}; public boolean isOwnerItem(int item) { for(int i = 0; i < ownerItem.length; i++) { if(ownerItem[i] == item) { return true; } } return false; }

Theres more, hold on, just ripping from my sever. You may have to change a few things… methods etc.

PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE Don’t just copy and paste this. You’ll get errors, adapt it to your current methods. AND BACK UP THE FILES FIRST.

public void DropItem() {
		int ItemId = inStream.readUnsignedWordA();
		int Unknown = inStream.readUnsignedByte() + inStream.readUnsignedByte();
		int Slot = inStream.readUnsignedWordA();
		if (!isownerItem(ItemId)) {
			if (playerItems[Slot]-1 == ItemId) {
				Server.s.itemHandler.PlayerDropItem(ItemId, playerItemsN[Slot], absX, absY, Slot, playerId);
			}
			RemoveAllWindows();
		} else {
			DestroyItem = ItemId;
			changeText126(getItemName(DestroyItem), 14184);
			frame34(DestroyItem, 14171);
			CurrentFrame = 14170;
			sendFrame164(14170);
		}
	}

Erm, the most important thing is trading, which I can’t seem to find at the moment. Then don’t forget dueling, wild drops etc. and it’d be too complicated for me to rip it all and adapt it all.

item.title: Owner items...[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Fixed:

if (playerRights < 3 && c.wearId == 1635) {

Edit: Also, shouldn’t you be returning true first, then false. Looks to me as if it’s returning false for ownerItem().

You want it to return true that the item is an ownerItem and sendMessage, if it’s false then you’re an owner and can equip.

Swap it around.

PS: there’s no need to delete the original post, we can work this out bit by bit and someone else could of chipped in.

Read full topic
